definition: Kong Yiji, protagonist of short story by Lu Xun 魯迅|鲁迅[Lu3 Xun4]
hole/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for cave dwellings
surname Kong

second of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/second in order/letter "B" or Roman "II" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/second party (in legal contract, usually 乙方[yi3 fang1], as opposed to 甲方[jia3 fang1])/ethyl/bent/winding/radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 5)/ancient Chinese compass point: 105°
turning stroke (in Chinese characters)/see also 折[zhe2]
self/oneself/sixth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/sixth in order/letter "F" or Roman "VI" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/hexa

sentences.english: Kong Yiji would go red in the face.
Kong Yiji was the only long-gowned drinker who took his wine standing up.
sentences.chinese: 孔乙己是站着喝酒而穿長衫的唯一的人。

sentences.english: Kong Yiji waited for a while, then said earnestly: “You can’t, can you?
sentences.chinese: 孔乙己等了許久，很懇切的說道，“不能寫罷？

sentences.english: Kong Yiji was the only one who stood drinking while wearing a robe.
sentences.chinese: 孔乙己是站着喝酒而穿長衫的唯一的人。

sentences.english: Kong was the only long-gowned customer to drink his wine standing.
sentences.chinese: 孔乙己是站着喝酒而穿長衫的唯一的人。

sentences.english: Kong Yiji was the only standing drinker who wore long robes.
sentences.chinese: 孔乙己是站著喝酒而穿長衫的唯一的人。

sentences.english: Kong Yiji stared at the guy who asked him, with a look of disdain.
sentences.chinese: 孔乙己看着問他的人，顯出不屑置辯的神氣。

sentences.english: I'd heard people say behind his back that Kong Yiji had studied.
sentences.chinese: 聽人家背地裏談論，孔乙己原來也讀過書。

sentences.english: Since then, I hadn’t see Kong Yiji for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 自此以後，又長久沒有看見孔乙己。

sentences.english: It was Kong Yiji facing the threshold, sitting by the counter.
sentences.chinese: 站起來向外一望，那孔乙己便在櫃檯下對了門檻坐着。

definition: star anise-flavored fava beans (snack from Shaoxing, Zhejiang province)
lit. short jacket party/working people/the toiling masses/blue collar workers
Lu Xun (1881-1936), one of the earliest and best-known modern Chinese writers
The Scholars, Qing dynasty novel by Wu Jingzi 吳敬梓|吴敬梓[Wu2 Jing4 zi3], an extended satire on the Imperial Examination system
Wu Jingzi (1701-1754), Qing dynasty novelist, author of The Scholars 儒林外史[Ru2 lin2 Wai4 shi3]
Zhu Ziqing (1898-1948), poet and essayist
theatrical performance (e.g. on religious festival)
Diary of a Madman by Lu Xun 魯迅|鲁迅[Lu3 Xun4]
Lao She (1899-1966), Chinese novelist and dramatist
Zhou Shuren, the real name of author Lu Xun 魯迅|鲁迅
Yuan Mei (1716-1798), famous Qing poet and critic, one of Three great poets of the Qianlong era 乾嘉三大家
Camel Xiangzi, novel by Lao She 老舍
The Travels of Lao Tsan, novel by late Qing novelist Liu E 劉鶚|刘鹗[Liu2 E4]
Guy de Maupassant (1850-1893), French novelist and short story writer
Honoré de Balzac (1799-1850), French novelist, author of series La comédie humaine
Liu E (1857-1909), late Qing novelist, author of 老殘遊記|老残游记[Lao3 Can2 You2 ji4]
